original: Karlholm, Bertil Karl Otto, provinsialläkare, Ullared, f. 28/5/02 i Valdemarsvik, östergötl. 1., av krono-länsm. Karl K. o. Teresia Janse. G. 34 m. Aksa Hedvall. Barn: Kerstin f. 36, Karl 39, Eva 42, Britta 44. — Stud:ex. i Skara 21, med. kand. i Sthlm 26, med. Hc. där 31. Assist :läk. v. Finspångs las. 31-32, kort. förordn. s. prov:iläk. i Valdemarsviks distr. samt s. järnv:läk. i Kungsbacka o. stadsläk. i Söderköp. 32, prov:läk. i Finspångs distr. 32 o. 33, i Offerdals distr. 33, und:läk. v. Styrsö kustsan. 33, tf. andre und:läk. v. Västerviks las. 32 o. 33, v. Uddevalla las. 33, andre und:läk. v. Västerviks las. 34-36, förste und :läk. v. Oskarshamns las. 36-39, andre und :läk. v. Eksjö san. 39-40, ett flert. förordn. s. prov :däk. o. stadsläk. 40-42, e. prov:läk. i Krist-dala 42-45, prov:läk. i Ullareds distr. sed. 45. Led. av komm:ful’lm. o. nyk-terh :ndn sed. 47.
translated:
Karlholm, Bertil Karl Otto, District Medical Officer, Ullared, b. 28/5/02 in Valdemarsvik, Östergötland, son of Karl K. and Teresia Janse. Married in 1934 to Aksa Hedvall. Children: Kerstin b. 1936, Karl b. 1939, Eva b. 1942, Britta b. 1944. 

Education: Student examination in Skara in 1921, Bachelor of Medicine in Stockholm in 1926, Doctor of Medicine in 1931. 

Professional experience: Assistant doctor at Finspång Hospital 1931-1932, temporary district medical officer in Valdemarsvik district and railway doctor in Kungsbacka and city doctor in Söderköping in 1932, district medical officer in Finspång district in 1932-1933, in Offerdal district in 1933, deputy doctor at Styrsö Coastal Sanatorium in 1933, temporary deputy doctor at Västervik Hospital in 1932-1933, assistant doctor at Uddevalla Hospital in 1933, deputy doctor at Västervik Hospital in 1934-1936, first assistant doctor at Oskarshamn Hospital in 1936-1939, deputy doctor at Eksjö Sanatorium in 1939-1940, multiple temporary appointments as district doctor and city doctor in 1940-1942, assistant doctor in Kristdala in 1942-1945, district medical officer in Ullared district since 1945. 

Member of the Municipal Health Committee and the Temperance Association since 1947.
